job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Duluth, MN
pros: Flexibility throughout scheduling as a casual

review_title: Wanted to retire from this one
job_title: Direct Support Staff/Caregiver in Duluth, MN
pros: The benefits package is great. They provide 1500 dollars in life insurance I believe after a year. The Christmas party was fun. The bonuses depend upon how many hours you worked for the year if they give you a bonus that year which in recent years they have. I enjoy working for this company. However...
cons: When it comes to upper management it appears to me that they are very clicky they look down upon their direct support staff. The way I see it is I don't feel like they would have a job if it wasn't for the direct support staff because they're not in there doing our jobs we are. I'm sure it's easy to forget the little guy when you're on top. Lead by example by putting the individuals that we serve first, show us, remind us that they come first. They are the true source of all of our incomes.

review_title: Depending on the program, it's a horrible place to work.
job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Duluth, MN
pros: The clients can be really fun and enjoy getting out to do fun activities. The pay is fine. The vacation time is fantastic if you can take it. Other benefits like medical and 401k are meh.
cons: The management does not care about their employees. They are understaffed and overworked, the staffing is unsafe at times. Even if you think you're doing a great job at work the management will tell you that you're doing a bad job. There's hours of yearly training to do online yet almost no hands-on training within the program, they throw you right into it and then reprimand you when you're doing something incorrectly instead of trying to help you learn. They will not make any accomodations for you as a person in terms of your schedule or things you aren't able to do due to physical or mental health. Gossip, favoritism and nepotism at its finest. Maybe not all the programs are like this but from what I've heard, they are.

review_title: Lack of competency in a particular Program Manager led to my parting this company.
pros: They pay well,  and in general I have had no problems with upper management, though i did not receive a response in regard to dissatisfaction I stated In a letter when leaving the company.
cons: I received guilt trips from my immediate supervisor over things which i had no control over.  Such as accusations me of being at fault, or not responding over a situation requiring implementation over training,  in which they hadn't trained me for as would have been their responsibility to do. My site location manager also shifted blame from himself by trying to do this. Later as i said,  my complaints of this nature were not addressed by management, at least not in response to my concerns.

pros: A pleasant environment for a seasonal job.
cons: Pay is not commensurate with level of education required ( college graduate).

pros: Eat with clients, great hourly wage, Vacation, Sick Time
cons: Some of the clients can be violent
